g.text: Temperature dependence of lattice parameters a, b and c of orthorhombic Ti
cooling and heating processes, in which the schematic unit cell is also showed.
Comparison of the projection drawings of the hexagonal structure (drawn in black) and
the orthorhombic structure (drawn in pink) of Ti
Sn from c axis, in which a, b axes of the hexagonal
structure and a’, b’ axes of the orthorhombic structure were also indicated.
3.3. Discussion on the Thermodynamic Possibility of Phase Transformation
Formation enthalpies of both hexagonal phase (Ti
were calculated using Equation (2). Considering the sole outer electrons of atom, for hexagonal Ti
. Also, when considering all the electrons
to the results of the two kinds of calculations above, both hexagonal phase and orthorhombic phase
the orthorhombic phase is more stable than the hexagonal phase, and the phase transformation from
hexagonal phase to orthorhombic phase is reasonable according to thermodynamics theory.
The following conclusions can be drawn fromthis work:
i. The reversible thermal induced phase transformation of Ti
Sn is demonstrated by the means of
